basics.name: John Imyeob Kim
basics.label: Full Stack Web Developer
basics.summary: I'm a highly driven software engineer from a program management background. I'm quick to learning new technologies and I do not shy away from new challenges. I believe that my drive and knowledge will be a great addition to the engineering team.

work.summary: I was the primary interface between customers and our engineering team.
highlights: Setup sales team and developed company website

work.summary: I worked as a Frontend Engineer for an iOS app called the Novelist.
highlights: Was featured at Techcrunch Disrupt Hackathon
Worked on development and Marketing for ios app called AT

volunteer.summary: Oragnized meetup events and hosted talks regarding iOS deveopment.

awards.title: Techcrunch Disrupt - Best Hack with Esri Techonology
awards.prize: Best use of Esri ArcGIS mapping technology wins $5,000 and 2 tickets to TechCrunch Distrupt valued at $6,000.

awards.title: Chime Hack 3
awards.prize: Global Citizenship (Sponsored by Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers) $5,000 cash prize and an interview (for each team member*) to be a KP Fellow with a KPCB portfolio company

awards.title: Hack Against Violence
awards.prize: Space at Runway, a disruptive incubator and co-working space, located in the Twitter building in downtown San Francisco.a disruptive incubator and co-working space, located in the Twitter building in downtown San Francisco.

projects.name: Secret Dot Club
projects.description: This is a winning project for TechCrunch Distrupt Hackathon 2016. The Secret Dot club uses Esri's geotagging features and IBM Watson Tone Analyzer to give thes users a unique map view of where excited and entertaining areas are

projects.name: The Partner
projects.description: Partner analyzes data from IRS 990 Filings for nonprofit organizations from Amazon Web Services and visually displays information about an organization's expenses, sources of revenue, and significant contributions to the community.

projects.name: Dear Ally
projects.description: This is a winning hackathon project from Chime Hack 3 hosted by Facebook. The project creates a safe chat room for victims of violence, and connects them to professionals that can give them immediate assistance.

projects.name: The Watch
projects.description: This is a winning hackathon project from Hack Against Violence hosted by Runway and DBC. The Watch scraps Twitter for tweets that match keywords that indicate users that show signs of suicide and puts them on our watch list

projects.name: Novelist
projects.description: A solo passion project. The Novelist create community generated stories. Users can vote on the next sentence, and after a voting period the sentence gets locked in.

projects.name: Foodie
projects.description: This project was featured at TechCrunch Distrup 2015. Tinder meets Yelp the app helps users decide on to eat quickly

projects.name: El Matador
projects.description: A passion project on the Andriod platform. El Matador is a game where you dodge bulls
